dt.t: the right to praise or {wi}blame{/wi} a literary work
says he's not {it}to blame{/it} for the accident

usages.pl: Is it {parahw}blame{/parahw} on or blame for?
pt: Use of {it}blame{/it} in sense 2b with {it}on{/it} has occasionally been disparaged as wrong. Such disparagement is without basis; {it}blame on{/it} occurs as frequently in carefully edited prose as {it}blame for.{/it} Both are standard.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}blamer, blasmer{/it}, from Late Latin {it}blasphemare{/it} to blaspheme, from Greek {it}blasphēmein{/it}
